articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 11th in G# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 11th in G# (Shape: E)

## Brief Description
This arpeggio is based on the 11th chord in the key of G#. In the E shape, it highlights the notes of the G# 11th chord, providing a unique and rich sound. Arpeggios are sequences of individual notes that make up a chord, played in a broken manner rather than simultaneously. This particular arpeggio adds color and depth to the G# chord, enhancing the harmonic complexity of the progression.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (G#)
- Major Third (B#)
- Perfect Fifth (D#)
- Minor Seventh (F#)
- Major Ninth (A#)
- Perfect Eleventh (C#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, based on the 11th chord in G#, is commonly found in jazz, fusion, and R&B genres. It contributes a smooth and sophisticated flavor to the music, adding a sense of tension and release. The extended nature of this arpeggio creates a lush and colorful sound that can evoke feelings of introspection and contemplation.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the G# 11th arpeggio:
1. Song: "So What" by Miles Davis
2. Song: "Just the Two of Us" by Bill Withers
3. Song: "Spain" by Chick Corea
